title: Dubai’s New Luxury Residential Projects Appeal to Affordability as Market Cools
text:
Dubai house prices plummeted to their lowest levels in over a decade in the second quarter of 2019, and even the most popular areas for prime real estate were no exception.

In the exclusive man-made island of Palm Jumeirah, where many residential projects are built, the average house price slipped 14% over the past year. And the thriving Dubai Marina, which overlooks a port of luxury yachts, has seen average home prices slip 13.5% since June 2018, Mansion Global previously reported.

However, this new downward trend presents a buying opportunity for investors who are eyeing their dream homes and aiming to buy low.

"Even though we expect the real estate market to continue to decline moderately towards the end of 2019, mainly due to supply and a slowdown in the growth of the largest economic sectors, we expect a healthy demand,” said Michelle Liddiard, luxury sales specialist at Luxhabitat.

“It will only be a matter of time where consumers build confidence and trust, which will in turn boost the real estate market and drive additional demand, given that many of the legislations are linked to property ownership,” she added.
